intro: Dysophylla quadrifolia var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dysophylla, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
